senses.sense: to start to be cold/ill/late, etc.

senses.lear_examp: It's getting late so I should finish now.

senses.sense: to become more ill, unpleasant, difficult, severe, etc. than before
senses.dict_examp: My cold seems to be getting worse.
senses.lear_examp: I thought, it couldn't get worse.

senses.sense: to have something done to you
senses.dict_examp: He got killed in the war.
senses.lear_examp: Two weeks ago many people at school got injured because of an explosion, so a TV company came to film what the school is like now ...

senses.sense: to produce an answer or result that is not correct, or to say or write something that is not correct
senses.dict_examp: I got most of the answers wrong.

senses.sense: to do a task, or to arrange for someone to do a task for you
senses.dict_examp: Could you get the kids dressed?
senses.lear_examp: First I have to go to the doctor and then I have to get my teeth checked by the dentist.

senses.sense: to contact someone
senses.dict_examp: Please get in touch if you ever come back to Madrid.
senses.lear_examp: Get in touch soon.

senses.sense: to move to a different place or into a different position
senses.dict_examp: I saw her getting into his car.
senses.lear_examp: They said that I got into a car by myself (they thought that I had believed the story).

senses.sense: to deal with or answer a ringing telephone, a knock on the door, etc.
senses.dict_examp: Could you get the phone, Al?

senses.sense: to spend time with someone or something so that you gradually learn more about them
senses.dict_examp: The first couple of meetings are for the doctor and patient to get to know each other.
senses.lear_examp: I hope you can come here and get to know him.

senses.sense: to throw something away or give something to someone because you no longer want it
senses.dict_examp: We must get rid of some of those old books.
senses.lear_examp: Do you think I'd better get rid of the sofa and place the bookshelf there?

senses.sense: to end something unpleasant
senses.dict_examp: I can't seem to get rid of this headache.
senses.lear_examp: The first step is to get rid of smoking.

senses.sense: to make something happen, or make someone or something do something
senses.dict_examp: I can't get my computer to work!
senses.lear_examp: We must get the councillors to change their minds.

senses.sense: to develop an opinion about a situation because of something that you notice
senses.dict_examp: I got the feeling that she was really angry about the situation.
senses.lear_examp: I disagree with some points you mentioned and would like to share the impression I got from that popular holiday report during my two-week trip.

senses.sense: to annoy someone, especially by doing something again and again

senses.sense: to have the chance to do something

senses.lear_examp: I did get to meet a musician, a singer named Anouk.

senses.sense: to understand or hear something
senses.dict_examp: That joke that he told  - did you get it?

senses.sense: to make an effort to control your emotions and behave more calmly
senses.dict_examp: Stop panicking and get a grip on yourself!
senses.lear_examp: The best thing to do was to talk to people who were not doing the test rather than building up my anxiety. However, I did not do this and it almost resulted in a disaster, but I got a grip on myself and just barely passed.

senses.sense: to make someone leave

senses.sense: to make sure that you completely understand a situation
senses.dict_examp: Let me get this straight - am I paying for this?
senses.lear_examp: Next time you should try to get your facts straight.

senses.sense: to become difficult to control

senses.sense: to learn how to do something, especially if it is not obvious or simple

senses.lear_examp: It was quite hard to get the hang of it, as I didn't have any knowledge of English.

senses.sense: to hurry
senses.dict_examp: We're leaving in five minutes, so get moving!

senses.sense: to hurry

senses.sense: used to say that someone understands a situation

senses.lear_examp: If you use a photograph though, you can be sure that everyone will get the picture (pun intended) and probably remember the person you're talking about next time they see him.

senses.sense: to begin

senses.sense: to tell someone about something that you have been worried or angry about for a long time

senses.sense: to manage to make someone understand or believe something

senses.lear_examp: I am going to get across several ideas to improve the look of our town.

senses.sense: to have a good relationship
senses.dict_examp: She and her new roommate are getting along.
senses.lear_examp: She is a journalist at the local newspaper and we get along very well.

senses.sense: to travel or move from place to place

senses.lear_examp: The island isn't too big so I think we could get around on foot.

senses.sense: to do something that you have intended to do for a long time

senses.sense: to be able to reach or get something
senses.dict_examp: I've put the cake on a high shelf where the kids can't get at it.

senses.lear_examp: The point I'm getting at is that you have to understand that young people look at sports like school: it's something you do that makes you feel good afterward and computer games are something you do when you have some spare time.

senses.sense: to leave or escape from a place or person, often when it is difficult to do this

senses.lear_examp: A bicycle is a means of making new friends, and getting away from your daily routine.

senses.sense: to go somewhere for a short vacation, often  because you need to rest
senses.dict_examp: I just need to get away for a few days.
senses.lear_examp: I've enjoyed the peace of getting away, you know I needed it.

senses.sense: to succeed in not being criticized or  punished for something

senses.lear_examp: When the police arrived, the criminals had already disappeared: they got away with this murder.

senses.sense: to return to a place after you have been somewhere else

senses.lear_examp: Will call you when I get back.

senses.sense: to be given something again that you had before

senses.lear_examp: He hoped that he would get back his suitcase.

senses.sense: to talk or write to someone at a later time to give them some information they asked for or because you were not able to speak to them before

senses.lear_examp: I am awfully sorry for having been slow in getting back to you.

senses.sense: to make someone feel unhappy

senses.lear_examp: But when I had finally reached the bottom of the valley seeing the whole ski group staring at me, the embarrassment got me down.

senses.sense: to start doing something seriously and with a lot of attention and effort

senses.lear_examp: Let's get down to business!

senses.sense: to succeed in entering a place, especially a building

senses.lear_examp: We had to hang out in front of the Museum for almost one hour. When we finally got in there, the tour was very short.

senses.sense: to arrive at a place at a particular time
senses.dict_examp: My flight gets in at 9:45 p.m.

senses.sense: to succeed in being chosen or elected
senses.dict_examp: He wanted to go to Stanford, but he didn't get in.
senses.lear_examp: For the first time I was trying to get in a University or a High College.

senses.sense: to succeed in being chosen or elected
senses.dict_examp: He got into Harvard.
senses.lear_examp: A month later on, I finally got into a High College of Education, but almost 400 km from home.

senses.sense: to become interested in an activity or subject, or start being involved in an activity

senses.lear_examp: Taking everything into account, I truly believe that "Ethnos" is the most suitable newspaper to be placed in the library ... for every student who would like to learn Greek deeply and get into the Greek culture and civilization.

senses.sense: to leave a bus, train, aircraft or boat

senses.sense: to go onto a bus, train, aircraft or boat

senses.sense: to make someone feel upset or angry

senses.sense: to wake up and get out of bed, or make someone do this

senses.lear_examp: My friend gets up early.

senses.sense: a present or something that is given

senses.sense: a natural ability or skill

senses.lear_examp: Animals like elephants, giraffes and exotic birds must be free. How would you feel living inside a cage?

senses.sense: a female child or young woman

senses.sense: a group of female friends

senses.sense: to provide someone with something

senses.sense: to perform an action

senses.sense: If something gives way, it falls because it is not strong enough to support the weight on top of it.
